Description: Black-figure Corinthian pottery footed aryballos, largely intact, with repair to lip and handle. Banding on top of rim; tongues on shoulder; bands on lower wall; edge of foot painted, small ring of glaze on underside; in field, large palmette cross flanked by ducks; heavily encrusted.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Mercer Art Gallery, Harrogate. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Vermeule, C. & von Bothmer, D. 1959, Notes on a New Edition of Michaelis: Ancient Marbles in Great Britain, part three: 2, American Journal of Archaeology 63 (4), p.329-348, pp.346 “Corinthian aryballos, from Naukratis (griffin-bird)”.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.330)
